title: [FR] Support Azure Stack Hub storage blob as MLflow Server artifact store
body:
## Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages new feature contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute an implementation of this feature (either as an MLflow Plugin or an enhancement to the MLflow code base)?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [x] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

mlflow server currently support Azure Storage Blob as default-artifact-root. Azure Stack Hub enables company  to create storage account on their own data centers (private cloud).  However  mlflow currently doesn't support this type of storage. 

## Motivation
- What is the use case for this feature?
- 
Company will be able to use their own azure-like  blob storage to save mflow artifiacts.

- Why is this use case valuable to support for MLflow users in general?

   Users using Azure stack hub will be more willing to use MLflow

- Why is it currently difficult to achieve this use case? 

  MLflow currently supports Azure Storage blob through hardcoded endpoint suffix like "blob.core.windows.net". This suffix doesn't apply to Azure Stack Hub Storage blob.
